ud6.4:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ud6.4:1.3: Now at that time several ascetics, brahmins, and wanderers who followed various other paths were residing in Sāvatthī, having different views and opinions, relying on different views.
ud6.4:2.1: There are some ascetics and brahmins who had this doctrine and view:
ud6.4:2.2: “The world is eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.”
